data.title: Mountain West 25th Season
data.text:
Craig Thompson’s Legacy

National sportscaster Mike Tirico describes the moment the Mountain West kicked off its inaugural football season and what it meant for college athletics. He, along with Kirk Herbstreit and Lee Corso broadcasted the first conference football game between Colorado State and BYU.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

First Conference Football Game

National sportscaster Mike Tirico describes the moment the Mountain West kicked off its inaugural football season and what it meant for college athletics. He, along with Kirk Herbstreit and Lee Corso broadcasted the first conference football game between Colorado State and BYU.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

BYU Women’s XC Wins National Title

Former BYU Cross Country standout Tara Rohatinsky Northcutt talks about the Cougars winning the 1999 NCAA Championship, which was the first national championship in Mountain West history. BYU went on to win the 2001 and 2002 national championships, as well.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Colorado State’s 23 Straight NCAA Tournament Bids

Former Colorado State Volleyball Coach Tom Hilbert talks about the Rams’ 23 straight NCAA Tournament bids and the passionate fan base in Fort Collins that elevated the program to national prominence.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Hnida’s Historic Kick

Former New Mexico placekicker Katie Hnida discusses becoming the first woman to play and score in an FBS football game and why the University of New Mexico was the perfect place to deliver the historic moment.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Utah Pounds Pitt in 2005 Fiesta Bowl

Utah becomes the original BCS Buster with its 35-7 victory over Pitt in the 2005 Fiesta Bowl. Former Utes defensive back Bo Nagahi relives the Utes’ run to a perfect season with a dominant performance over the Panthers.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Moore Wins National Golf Title

Former UNLV golfer Ryan Moore recalls winning the individual national title in men’s golf in 2004 and how the Rebels program put him on a path for great success on the course.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Two Utes, Two Top Picks In Two Months

Voice of the Utes Bill Riley details the transformative two months in which the Mountain West and the University of Utah had the No. 1 overall pick in both the NFL and NBA drafts in 2005.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Mountain West Sports Network Launch

Former Mountain West Sports Network anchor Marius Payton discusses the Mountain West launching the first television network dedicated exclusively to one college conference and the impact that it made on the current broadcast landscape.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Wyoming’s 2007 WNIT Championship

Former Wyoming women’s basketball coach Joe Legerski reminisces about the Cowgirls’ 2007 WNIT championship that drew over 15,000 fans to the Arena Auditorium and how that lifted the program to new heights that it enjoys today.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Utah Dominates Alabama in 2009 Sugar Bowl

Utah completes a second undefeated season in the span of four years with a 31-17 win over Alabama. Former All-Mountain West linebacker Stevenson Sylvester explains why the Utes were never intimidated by one of college football’s perennial powerhouse programs.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Strasburg Drafted With No. 1 Pick In MLB Draft

SDSU baseball broadcaster Chris Ello explains what made Aztecs pitcher Stephen Strasburg so dominant during his time on the Mesa and why he was drafted with the top pick in the 2009 MLB Draft.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

TCU Beats Wisconsin in 2011 Rose Bowl

TCU completes a perfect season with a Rose Bowl victory over Wisconsin, 21-19. Former All-Mountain West linebacker Tank Carder explains how the Horned Frogs outlasted the Badgers in Pasadena.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Fredette Scores 52 In The Midst Of “JimmerMania”

Former BYU basketball player Jimmer Fredette discusses the phenomenon that became known as “JimmerMania,” his 52-point game in the Mountain West tournament and winning multiple national player of the year honors in 2011.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Boise State Beats Arizona in 2014 Fiesta Bowl

Boise State wins the 2014 Fiesta Bowl in a 38-30 thriller in the first year of the College Football Playoff/NY6 Bowl format. Former Broncos quarterback Grant Hedrick takes a trip down memory lane to reminisce about Boise State’s third straight Fiesta Bowl victory.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

New Mexico Women’s XC National Reign

Former New Mexico Cross Country Head Coach Joe Franklin talks about the five-year stretch in which the Lobos won four NCAA Championships, including two team titles and two individual titles.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Mountain West Dominates Steeplechase

Former Air Force distance runner Mahala Norris talks about her national championship in the 3,000-meter steeplechase and the Mountain West’s run of five straight titles in the event from 2016-2021

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Pumphrey Becomes NCAA Career Rushing Leader

Former San Diego State running back Donnel Pumphrey discusses the 2016 Las Vegas Bowl that staged his record-setting moment when he set the NCAA career rushing record.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Allie Ostrander’s Three-peat

Former Boise State distance runner reflects on her three straight national championships in the 3,000-meter steeplechase.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch

Sherle’s Record-Setting Sendoff

Former Boise State soccer standout Raimee Sherle Ranstrom talks about her final matches as a Bronco which included a hat trick in the semifinals of the MW Championship, the game-winning goal in the championship final and solidifying herself as the Mountain West’s all-time leader in goals and points.

(Opens in a new tab) Watch
